DataElement.preferredName: Patient Major Surgical Procedure Prior To Treatment And Negation Complete Recovery Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Ind
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded indicator to determine clinical trial participation for questions related to the administration of therapeutic agents prior to major surgery and the negation of a complete healing process from major surgery.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Major Surgical Procedure Prior To Therapeutic Procedure And Negation Complete Recovery Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._Greater or bigger in amount, extent, or size._A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery._Earlier in time or order._Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement._An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process._An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence._An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction._To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion._A healing process and/or an outcome implying relative health.  The term is typically used in the context of direct and indirect effects of sickness or injury._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Major Surgical Procedure Prior To Therapeutic Procedure And Negation Complete Recovery Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Greater or bigger in amount, extent, or size.:A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.:Earlier in time or order.:Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.:An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.:An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.:To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.:A healing process and/or an outcome implying relative health.  The term is typically used in the context of direct and indirect effects of sickness or injury.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: Greater or bigger in amount, extent, or size.

A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.
Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.
An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.
A healing process and/or an outcome implying relative health.  The term is typically used in the context of direct and indirect effects of sickness or injury.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Did patient have major surger
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient have major surgery within 28 days of starting therapy and did not recover from any effects of major surgery?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had major surgery within 2 weeks of starting study treatment or has NOT recovered from any effects of any major surgery?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had major surgery within 2 weeks of starting therapy and has failed to recover to less than or equal to grade 1, with the exception of stable chronic grade 2 toxicities that are not overlapping with presumed toxicities of olaparib and/or AZD6738?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient had major surgery, have they failed to adequately recover from the toxicity and/or complications from the intervention prior to starting therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient have major surgery within 2 weeks of starting study treatment and did not recover from any effects of major surgery that occurred more than 2 weeks prior to starting study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had major surgical procedure or significant traumatic injury (as judged by the investigator) within 28 days before start of treatment, or has not recovered from major side effects, open biopsy within 7 days before start of treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient have major surgery (e.g., GI surgery or removal or biopsy of brain metastasis) within 4 weeks before first dose of study treatment and complete wound healing from major surgery has not occurred 1 month before the first dose of study treatment and from minor surgery (e.g., simple excision or tooth extraction) at least 10 days before the first dose?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient not recovered from major surgery that occurred less than or equal to 4 weeks prior to initiating protocol therapy, as judged by the treating investigator?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient have major surgery (e.g., GI surgery or removal or biopsy of brain metastasis) within 4 weeks before first dose of study treatment and complete wound healing from major surgery has not occurred 1 month before the first dose of study treatment and from minor surgery (e.g., mediport placement, simple excision or tooth extraction) at least 10 days before the first dose?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient undergone a major surgical procedure prior to Cycle 1, Day 1 and has not recovered to ECOG performance status 0, 1 or 2 (Karnofsky greater than or equal to 60%)?
